poem:
Inadequate Response

In air's thin thread, they drift,  
tethered to silence;  
grief's heavy fog descends,  
a nation stumbles in its wake,  
bruised echoes unanswered.  
What are lives to those  
who bind themselves in red?  
Atears' weight,  
unmeasured by the scales  
of an indifferent sun.  
Families untethered,  
searching for voices  
lost in political whispers.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The family of Akeel Nanabawa and Hannaa Vorajee and their four-year-old daughter Sara Nanabawa are calling on the UK government to improve how it is communicating with the family". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
